term.title: analytical run

item.text: Set of measurements of the same quantity performed under repeatability conditions of measurement.

notes.item: An analytical run may comprise measurements on one or more reference materials, blank materials, quality control materials, and analytical samples.

sources.item: PAC, 2021, 93, 997. 'Metrological and quality concepts in analytical chemistry (IUPAC Recommendations 2021)' on page 1000 (https://doi.org/10.1515/pac-2019-0819)

term.citation: Citation: 'analytical run' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.08006

term.disclaimer: The International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC) is continuously reviewing and, where needed, updating terms in the Compendium of Chemical Terminology (the IUPAC Gold Book). Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
